result.execSummary:
The defendant Shawna Jean Stamper was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Possess Drug Paraphernalia, an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 961.573(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

parties.name: Portage County Clerk of Circuit Court

supervisions.notes: Pay fine of $25 plus costs.   Pay within 60 days or set up a payment plan.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Shawna Jean Stamper

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt:
ADDRESS INFO for Shawna Jean Stamper
Current: 666 Main Street, Junction City, WI 54443 United States  (Effective: 08-17-2015)
Prior: 2804 County Road Ii, Stevens Point, WI 54481

Defendant Shawna Jean Stamper in court with attorney Jerod Barkley. Cass W Cousins appeared for the State of Wisconsin.

10:41 a.m.  Court calls case.
Atty Cousins states the appearances.

Plea questionnaire/Agreement filed.
Prosecutor states plea agreement.
Attorney for Defendant concurs with agreement stated.

Defendant enters a plea of: 
Count 1 - Guilty 

Court questions Defendant regarding plea.
Court informs Defendant of Constitutional Rights. Court advises Defendant of Elements State must prove for the Charge.
Court questions Attorney for Defendant.
Court finds Defendant's Plea is freely, voluntarily and intelligently made.
Attorneys stipulate that there is factual basis for the charge(s).

BY THE COURT:
Court finds a sufficient factual basis to support the charge(s).
Court finds the defendant guilty on Count 1.  Clerk directed to enter Judgment of Conviction this date.

Atty Cousins makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Atty Barkley makes sentencing arguments to the Court. 
Defendant does not wish to make a statement prior to sentencing.

BY THE COURT:
Count 1 - 
Pay fine of $25.00 plus costs - includes victim witness surcharge, DNA surcharge and filing fee
Pay within 60 days or set up the payment plan 
20 days with which to appeal
for Attorney to Appear and Act

Do not possess/consume controlled substances without a valid prescription and be taken according to the prescription. 
Do not possess any drug paraphernalia. 
Do not associate with any persons possessing or consuming illegal controlled substances.
  Submit to photographs and fingerprinting by the agency or to the law enforcement agency named in the criminal complaint.

Defendant Shawna Jean Stamper in court. David R. Knaapen appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Attorney/Defendant received copy of criminal complaint.
Court informs defendant of charges and maximum penalties.
Attorney/Defendant waives reading of complaint.

Court advises defendant of right to counsel/Public Defender representation.
Court enters NOT GUILTY plea on defendant's behalf.

State recommends a $ bond with conditions as stated.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for June 22, 2015 at 10:30 am.
